qas.question: In what area of Greenland can glaciers move 20-30m per day?
Increasing slope, thickness, snowfall, longitudinal confinement, basal temperature, and meltwater production result in increased what?
How far do glaciers generally move per day?
Why are some glaciers stagnant in Alaska?

answers.text: trees can establish themselves on surface sediment deposits

qas.question: What typically moves at around 3 meters a day?
What grows on moving glaciers in Alaska?

context: Mean speeds vary greatly, but is typically around <a2_0>1 m (3 ft)<a2_0/> per day. There may be no motion in stagnant areas; for example, in parts of Alaska, <a3_0><b5_0><b6_0>trees<b6_0/><b5_0/> can establish themselves on surface sediment deposits<a3_0/>. In other cases, <b4_0>glaciers<b4_0/> can move as fast as 20–30 m (70–100 ft) per day, such as in Greenland's <a0_0>Jakobshavn Isbræ<a0_0/> (Greenlandic: Sermeq Kujalleq). <a1_0><b7_0>Velocity<a1_0/> increases<b7_0/> with increasing slope, increasing thickness, increasing snowfall, increasing longitudinal confinement, increasing basal temperature, increasing meltwater production and reduced bed hardness.
